title: Richard P. Nielsen (academic)
text:
Richard P. Nielsen is the Professor of Management and Organization at <a href="Boston%20College">Boston College</a>'s <a href="Carroll%20School%20of%20Management">Carroll School of Management</a> and a past President of the <a href="Society%20for%20Business%20Ethics">Society for Business Ethics</a>.
Biography.
Nielsen was born in 1946 in <a href="New%20York%20City">New York City</a>. He has bachelor's and master's degrees from the <a href="Wharton%20School%20of%20the%20University%20of%20Pennsylvania">Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania</a> and a Ph.D. from <a href="Syracuse%20University">Syracuse University</a>.
He has served as President, Program Chair, and Executive Board Member of the <a href="Society%20for%20Business%20Ethics">Society for Business Ethics</a>. He has also served as Senior Editor for "<a href="Organization%20Studies%20%28journal%29">Organization Studies (journal)</a>", and is currently serving on the Editorial Boards of "<a href="Business%20Ethics%20Quarterly">Business Ethics Quarterly</a>", "<a href="Business%20and%20Professional%20Ethics%20Journal">Business and Professional Ethics Journal</a>", "Journal of Academic Ethics", and "Sustainability Accounting, Management and Policy Journal".
